channel.title: What is wrong with my compiler?

item.title: What is wrong with my compiler?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

I really feel like you should be using an IDE when you get that many dependencies/packages. Constructing a huge javac command is a royal pain in the dick and you shouldn’t have to deal with it.

Read full topic
item.source: What is wrong with my compiler?

item.title: What is wrong with my compiler?

@xx_matty_xx wrote:

If your compiler is broken you should file a bug report with Sun/Oracle/whoever owns Java these days.

item.source: What is wrong with my compiler?

item.title: What is wrong with my compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Loudas Loudas
item.description:
@Loudas wrote:

@echo off
title Server Compiling!
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_40\bin\javac.exe” -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d src\server\model\items*.java src\server\model\npcs*.java src\server\model\objects*.java src\server\model\players*.java src\server\model\players\skills*.java src\server\model\players\packets*.java src\server\model\shops*.java src\server\net*.java src\server\util*.java src\server\world*.java src\server*.java
pause

And i get and error that says:
javac: not a directory: src\server\model\items\GameItem.java
usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options

src\server\model\items\GameItem.java does exist.
I also have an IDE and my jdk is updated.

Read full topic
item.source: What is wrong with my compiler?
